info.description: Endpoint for doing various actions connected to a account
info.title: Account details API

tags.name: Create an account
tags.description:
Endpoints for creating an account

Idempotent Requests

Endpoints in this section support idempotency, which means that you can safely submit identical requests without making changes to the data storage twice. To perform an idempotent request, provide x-idempotency-key header with the request.

Idempotency works by saving URL, method, and idempotency header of your request as a key and the result of the request as value for 24 hours.

In case an error occurs while processing the request, the error message will be persisted and resent on possible retries. Please note that fields of uuid and timestamp fields of the error will be regenerated to be able to track down the identity of each error.

Idempotency key needs to be a unique value generated by the client which server then uses to activate the feature to be able to recognize possible future retries of the same request. The max length of the idempotency key is 64 characters.

tags.name: Update an account
tags.description:
Endpoints for updating an account

Idempotent Requests

Endpoints in this section support idempotency, which means that you can safely submit identical requests without making changes to the data storage twice. To perform an idempotent request, provide x-idempotency-key header with the request.

Idempotency works by saving URL, method, and idempotency header of your request as a key and the result of the request as value for 24 hours.

In case an error occurs while processing the request, the error message will be persisted and resent on possible retries. Please note that fields of uuid and timestamp fields of the error will be regenerated to be able to track down the identity of each error.

Idempotency key needs to be a unique value generated by the client which server then uses to activate the feature to be able to recognize possible future retries of the same request. The max length of the idempotency key is 64 characters.

post.description: Basic operation for updating an account. Check parameter updateProperty for possible parameters to update

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The accountId of which account you want to update

parameters.name: auditUser
parameters.description: The audit user to log the request

parameters.name: propertyToUpdate
parameters.description:
What property you want to update
   * __DELETE_ADDRESS__ - Deletes address.
   * __DELETE_EINVOICE_ADDRESS_AND_OPERATOR__ - Deletes einvoice address and operator.
   * __WRITE_OFF__ - Write-off uncollectible debt for given account id and book it as a loss. **Only applicable for CREDIT accounts**.

400.description: Given property to update is invalid

accountTemplate.description: Template name for which the account should be connected to

address.description: Address connected to an account that will override the address set on customer level. This is for example used when sending out statements

accountTemplate.description: Template name for which the account is connected to

address.description: Address connected to an account that will override the address set on customer level. This is for example used when sending out statements

parentId.description:
This field is used when the institution is setting up an account liability hierarchy.
The parentId is used to determine the parent of this account.
Consult Enfuce before using this field.

address.description: Address connected to an account that will override the address set on customer level. This is for example used when sending out statements

productCode.description:
This field is used when the institution has multiple account products setup.
The productCode is used to determine the specific account product.
Use of this field as well as the values of the field, is dependent on institution setup and should be aligned with Enfuce prior to use.

address.description: Address connected to an account that will override the address set on customer level. This is for example used when sending out statements. Full address object is expected to be set when updating.

parentId.description:
This field is used when the institution is setting up an account liability hierarchy.
The parentId is used to determine the top account of the account hierarchy.
Consult Enfuce before using this field.

address.description: Address connected to an account that will override the address set on customer level. This is for example used when sending out statements. Full address object is expected to be set when updating.

template.description: Template name for which the account is connected to

updateResourceBody.title: updateResourceBody
updateResourceBody.description: Should set the value of the property you are updating, leave rest empty

writeOffType.description: This value is optional, if not given `WRITE_OFF` is used.

accountNumber.description: Unique account number for given account. Must be numeric if paymentRefence.type defined as MOD10 or FINNISH_7_3_1!

fleetAdditionalInvoiceDaysOfMonth.description: Additional days in a month when an invoice will be created.

creditAdditionalInvoiceDaysOfMonth.description: Additional days in month when statement/invoice will be created

dueDate.description: Due date for the latest invoice

externalBalanceCheck.description:
The external balance check parameter enables the issuer to determine per account, whether the available balance during authorisation process should be checked by Enfuce or issuer (utilising Authorisation Control service). 
When set to true, Enfuce will not check the available balance of the account rather the issuer is expected to do it. 
As the parameter is set on account level, it will automatically apply to all cards linked to account in question. 
Please note that utilisation of this parameter requires implementation of the Authorisation Control service.

externalCustomerReference.description: To be printed on invoice in order for customer to handle invoice properly

id.description: Unique account id for given account

invoiceDayOfMonth.description: This will set the last day of the billing period. An invoice will be created and sent on the next day. If the day of the month day is exceeding the number of days in a given month then it will be the end of the month.

invoicedBalance.description: This amount represents the due payment expected from the customer. Please note that it does not include any potential overdue balances.

overdueBalance.description: The balance that remains unpaid after the due date has passed.

parentId.description: Account id of parent account. If empty then this is parent contract.

creditPaymentTerms.description:
Number of days to allow for invoice to be paid before it goes overdue.

Use of this field as well as the values of the field, is dependent on institution setup and should be aligned with Enfuce before taking into use.

fleetPaymentTerms.description:
Number of days to allow for invoice to be paid before it goes overdue.

The valid values for the parameter are integers between 1 and 31 (inclusive) and the specific value 45

subAccountTemplates.description: Templates for sub accounts to be created. Check usage with Enfuce!

name.description: Human readable name of an account

bodyTemplate.description: Request body template given based on selected property.

productCodeInRequest.description:
This field is used when the institution has multiple account products setup.
The productCode is used to determine the specific account product.
Use of this field as well as the values of the field, is dependent on institution setup and should be aligned with Enfuce prior to use.

productCodeInResponse.description:
The productCode is used to determine the specific account product.
Values of the field are dependent on institution setup.

collectionTriggerDate.description: Date when statement is sent to collection
Date when statement is sent to collection

country.description: A valid ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country code, except for QZZ (UNMIK in Kosovo) and ROM for Romania.

segment.description: Field enables to group an entity into a segment. This field will be exported but no logic is applied to this in Enfuce API
segment.title: segment

paymentReference.description: Number connected to account that will be used to map incoming payments to

invoicePaymentMethod.description:
Use of this field as well as the values of the field, is dependent on institution setup and should be aligned with Enfuce prior to use.
Also, it is only a value, there is no functionality behind it.

description.description: Short description of the result of the action

id.description: Will contain the ID of the resource that has been created or updated

code.description: An error code indicating what kind of error. I.e. HTTP error code

errorCode.description: Enfuce code for a specific error type

errorReason.description: Free-form text explaining the error reason

closureReason.description: Field enables to define entity's closure reason. This field will be exported but no logic is applied to this in Enfuce API
closureReason.title: closureReason

code.description:
Time period of usage limiter. Available usage limiters are:
   * __24H__ - sliding window limiter for the last 24 hours
   * __DAILY__ - Daily limiters are not part of standard usage limiter setup. Use of this field as well as the values of the field, is dependent on institution setup and should be aligned with Enfuce prior to use.
   * __MONTHLY__ - limiter for the current month starting on 1st
   * __WEEKLY__ - limiter for current week starting on Monday
   * __ANNUAL_YEARLY__ - Annual yearly limiters are not part of standard usage limiter setup. Use of this field as well as the values of the field, is dependent on institution setup and should be aligned with Enfuce prior to use.
   * __ROLLING_YEARLY__ - Rolling yearly limiters are not part of standard usage limiter setup. Use of this field as well as the values of the field, is dependent on institution setup and should be aligned with Enfuce prior to use.

Note that all values must be present when set. Usage limiter values are:
  * __ATM__ - ATM max withdrawal limit
  * __RETAIL__ - Retail max purchase limit
  * __ALL__ - All usage max limit

reset.description: If set to true this specific usage limit will be reset to product default and any other values sent in to the request will be ignored.

singleAmount.description: The max amount of single transaction. If set to 0 it will not be effective, unless count and sumAmount are also set to 0.

count.description: The max number of actions allowed per time period. If set to 0 then it will effectively block.

sumAmount.description: the max allowed amount allowed per time period. If set to 0 then it will effectively block.

accountStatusPatchV4.description: If account status is updated to ACCOUNT_COLLECTION, it is not allowed to be updated back to any other status.
accountStatusPatchV4.title: accountStatusPatchV4

availableAmount.description: Available amount for specific usage limit. Note this is not present if sumAmount is not set.

availableCount.description: Available count for specific usage limit. Note this is not present if count is not set.

usedAmount.description: Used amount for specific usage limit

usedCount.description: Used count for specific usage limit

interestRates.description: Revolving or overdue Interest rate percentages that is effective for the account.
